intro: Orbignya pixuna, commonly known as the pink pisonia, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean islands. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces fleshy, red berries that contain seeds surrounded by a mucilaginous coating. Orbignya pixuna is adapted to coastal environments and can tolerate salt spray, making it a common species in beachfront habitats. Its ecological importance includes providing food for various birds and insects.
